issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

fields.customfield_12310192: Unsuccessful tasks now log hostname and rackname to job history.

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
Found this while running jobs on a cluster with [~Karams].

This is because TaskAttemptUnsuccessfulCompletionEvent history record doesn't have a rack field.
fields.summary: No rack-name logged in JobHistory for unsuccessful tasks

comments.body: Provided the patch for this. Please review it.

+1 overall.  Here are the results of testing the latest attachment 
  http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12502933/MAPREDUCE-3349.patch
  against trunk revision .

    +1 @author.  The patch does not contain any @author tags.

    +1 tests included.  The patch appears to include 9 new or modified tests.

    +1 javadoc.  The javadoc tool did not generate any warning messages.

    +1 javac.  The applied patch does not increase the total number of javac compiler warnings.

    +1 findbugs.  The patch does not introduce any new Findbugs (version 1.3.9) warnings.

    +1 release audit.  The applied patch does not increase the total number of release audit warnings.

    +1 core tests.  The patch passed unit tests in .

    +1 contrib tests.  The patch passed contrib unit tests.

Test results: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-MAPREDUCE-Build/1272//testReport/
Console output: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-MAPREDUCE-Build/1272//console

This message is automatically generated.
Linking the related test-bug which can be fixed as part of the same patch.

Kindly make sure that Rumen's {{TopologyBuilder}} is also fixed in this JIRA. {{TopologyBuilder}} expects hostname in the form '/rack/host' and uses {{TaskAttemptFinishedEvent}} and {{TaskAttemptUnsuccessfulCompletionEvent}} for the same. It also uses split-location from {{TaskStartedEvent}}. Since the hostnames and racknames are now separately logged, we need to make sure that {{TopologyBuilder}} is aware of that.
I tried adding the missing pieces reusing the earlier patch. Fixed the bug mentioned by Vinod. Fixed Rumen. Unable to test the patch due to some maven issues.
submitting patch for jenkins

-1 overall.  Here are the results of testing the latest attachment 
  http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12505869/MAPREDUCE-3349-v1.4.patch
  against trunk revision .

    +1 @author.  The patch does not contain any @author tags.

    +1 tests included.  The patch appears to include 9 new or modified tests.

    +1 javadoc.  The javadoc tool did not generate any warning messages.

    +1 javac.  The applied patch does not increase the total number of javac compiler warnings.

    -1 findbugs.  The patch appears to introduce 12 new Findbugs (version 1.3.9) warnings.

    +1 release audit.  The applied patch does not increase the total number of release audit warnings.

    +1 core tests.  The patch passed unit tests in .

    +1 contrib tests.  The patch passed contrib unit tests.

Test results: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-MAPREDUCE-Build/1386//testReport/
Findbugs warnings: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-MAPREDUCE-Build/1386//artifact/trunk/hadoop-mapreduce-project/patchprocess/newPatchFindbugsWarningshadoop-mapreduce-examples.html
Console output: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-MAPREDUCE-Build/1386//console

This message is automatically generated.

Amar, the ant build is failing with the patch. It's renamed getRackname to getRackName in MapAttempteFinishedEvent - and JobBuilder is still using the old name.

+1 for the MR side changes. Should be possible to test after fixing JobBuilder. Or were there some other maven issues ?

Missed this in the previous review - a null check is required on setting the rack name when creating TaskAttemptUnsuccessfulCompletionEvent in TaskAttemptImpl. That's already in place while setting rackname in Map/ReduceAttemptFinishedEvent.
Attaching a patch incorporating Sid's comments. I was unable to test this patch. I will upload the test results soon.

-1 overall.  Here are the results of testing the latest attachment 
  http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12506704/MAPREDUCE-3349-v1.6.patch
  against trunk revision .

    +1 @author.  The patch does not contain any @author tags.

    +1 tests included.  The patch appears to include 9 new or modified tests.

    +1 javadoc.  The javadoc tool did not generate any warning messages.

    +1 javac.  The applied patch does not increase the total number of javac compiler warnings.

    +1 eclipse:eclipse.  The patch built with eclipse:eclipse.

    +1 findbugs.  The patch does not introduce any new Findbugs (version 1.3.9) warnings.

    +1 release audit.  The applied patch does not increase the total number of release audit warnings.

    -1 core tests.  The patch failed these unit tests:
                  org.apache.hadoop.mapreduce.v2.app.TestStagingCleanup
                  org.apache.hadoop.mapreduce.v2.app.TestJobEndNotifier

    +1 contrib tests.  The patch passed contrib unit tests.

Test results: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-MAPREDUCE-Build/1468//testReport/
Console output: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-MAPREDUCE-Build/1468//console

This message is automatically generated.
Canceling patch. TestRumenJobTraces is still failing.

Attaching a new patch that fixes the test cases failures and few corner cases detected while fixing the tests. 

test-patch passed. JUnit tests pass. I manually tested the patch and now Rumen is capable of generating topology files.
With this patch, there is no difference between the files topology files generated using 0.20.x and trunk.

+1 overall.  Here are the results of testing the latest attachment 
  http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12508093/MAPREDUCE-3349-v1.11.patch
  against trunk revision .

    +1 @author.  The patch does not contain any @author tags.

    +1 tests included.  The patch appears to include 18 new or modified tests.

    +1 javadoc.  The javadoc tool did not generate any warning messages.

    +1 javac.  The applied patch does not increase the total number of javac compiler warnings.

    +1 eclipse:eclipse.  The patch built with eclipse:eclipse.

    +1 findbugs.  The patch does not introduce any new Findbugs (version 1.3.9) warnings.

    +1 release audit.  The applied patch does not increase the total number of release audit warnings.

    +1 core tests.  The patch passed unit tests in .

    +1 contrib tests.  The patch passed contrib unit tests.

Test results: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-MAPREDUCE-Build/1480//testReport/
Console output: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-MAPREDUCE-Build/1480//console

This message is automatically generated.

+1, the patch looks good for trunk. Ran some of the rumen tests locally and they passed.
The patch doesn't apply to branch-0.23 though. After resolving the conflicts, looks like it depends on some changes made in MAPREDUCE-778. Amar, could you please upload another patch for branch-0.23. Thanks

Sid,
Does it makes sense to port MAPREDUCE-778 to 0.23? Its an important feature and affects only Rumen.

bq.
Does it makes sense to port MAPREDUCE-778 to 0.23? Its an important feature and affects only Rumen.

Don't have enough context on how Rumen is currently used and what changes with 778. Seems like a new feature, and since it affects only Rumen, I don't see any issue with it being merged into 23. However, it's best if the RM or someone with more context takes that call.
I just committed this to trunk. Thanks Devaraj for the early patch. Thanks Vinod and Sid for helping with the reviews.

Attached is a patch for branch-0.23. test-patch passed on my local box. JUnit test related to Rumen and Gridmix passed. Ran TraceBuilder on a large dataset and it passed. Topology file is generated and now contains the cluster topology layout. The output is same as that of trunk i.e 0.24.
+1 for the branch-23 patch. Committed. Thanks Amar and Devaraj.
